Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description: * *  *   *    Job Description*    *   *    *     The Department of Commerce is launching an initiative to leverage data to strengthen trust in Utah’s commercial activities. As such, we are looking for a talented individual to build and manage thoughtful, user-centric dashboards that transform rows of data into data stories and solutions. The candidate chosen will have the opportunity to build a system from the ground up, making determinations on the system architecture, what data to gather, how to present it in a digestible way, and how to use the information to better inform Utah agencies and the public.*     This position will be in the office for training, then teleworking may be an option.*     PRINCIPAL DUTIES*      In this position, you will provide department-wide support to use technology to automate, analyze, and present data. You will establish and maintain public dashboards. You will establish and maintain internal dashboards that will include data critical to the Department of Commerce's efficiency and operations. You will recommend systems and software that can be used to collect and analyze all data.*      This is a senior-level job, where your duties may include but not be limited to the following:*    *     Working closely with stakeholders to define agency objectives and develop data visualizations, dashboards and data stories;*      Interacting with agency leadership and staff to understand business needs, requirements, and timelines and manage project plans to deliver high-quality data products;*      Designing, developing, and implementing advanced visualizations, interactive dashboards, self-service visualization tools, and infographics to communicate key insights;*      Creating data stories that combine data visualizations, text, and graphics to communicate in a compelling, action-oriented way;*      Coordinating the use of information analysis related hardware, software, and data with the agency's employees and/or the public;*      Interfacing with data processing users to automate applications and/or resolve application and operating problems;*      Ensuring deadlines are met;*      Negotiating common standards for data formats;*      Assessing needs for data analysis related hardware, software, and data;*      Making recommendations to management for improving and/or maintaining effective information analysis support for the organization;*      Resolving complex operation and/or data processing issues;*      Monitoring system performance;*      Making recommendations for enhancements;*      Reviewing systems to ensure compliance with procedures, policies, regulations; and*      Facilitating/chair workgroups, etc.*     THE IDEAL CANDIDATE*     Our model Data Analyst has:*     Experience creating visualizations and reports that are dynamic, intuitive, effective and easily interpretable for a range of user types*      Experience using data visualization software (examples include, but are not limited to Tableau, Power BI, Cognos Analytics, R Shiny, etc.) and other technology to*      Fluency in best practices for data visualization; Strong knowledge of visualization principles and techniques*      Ability to work with large amounts of data and information and see the ‘bigger picture’*      Able to articulate data issues and report solutions clearly and be a very good communicator with excellent Oral/written, presentation skills to various audiences amongst the organization*      Excellent at capturing business needs and drivers in user stories that are meaningful to business stakeholders*      Data Driven and Passionate – strong analytical mindset with exceptional data analysis skills, including attention to detail, accuracy and ability to manage numerous data points to provide valuable insights*      Ability to use innate curiosity to collaborate with different business units to co-create solutions*      Blend of strategic and tactical thinking, creative and analytic reasoning with the ability to decompose complex business problems into their constituent parts*      Ability to work independently with high attention to detail, and focused on the timely completion of deliverables*      Knowledge of statistical principles, methods, procedures, and standards; and*      Experience analyzing data for quality measures (timeliness, accuracy, completeness).*     PREFERENCES*     Preferences will be given to applicants with:*     Experience working with relational databases and SQL;*      Experience with statistical programming languages, including knowledge of R and Python;*      A bachelor’s degree in statistics, machine learning, mathematics, computer science, economics, or any other related quantitative field or at least 4 years of related working experience in the data analytics discipline.*     WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN OUR TEAM*     The Department of Commerce houses 8 divisions that provide different data to the public-at-large and for internal process improvement. To date, the collection and analysis of this data has been done by managers who do not have data-specific expertise. This position would reside in Commerce's administrative group and provide department-wide support to use technology to automate and analyze data throughout the department, as well as recommend the systems and software used to collect and analyze that data. As the data visualization expert for Commerce, you would be able to develop and create what is needed to take Commerce to the next level.*     This position is eligible for a rich benefits package, generous paid time off, and a great work-life balance. You can learn more about offered benefits here.*    AGENCY*     The Department of Commerce is the licensing and registration agency for Utah's professional and business community. We provide oversight of business registrations, trademarks, Uniform Commercial Code filings, occupational and professional licensing, consumer protection, public utilities, securities, real estate and residential mortgage lending. Title: Business Analyst - Core Transformation
